intro: Chironia scabra, commonly known as the rough chironia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia and often grows in moist, shaded environments. Chironia scabra is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of its family.
